column4: can anyone help me out with a modem setting? I need to set my external seral port modem to work as Pulse and not Tone. Here is the string I use in withing Hylafax settings: ModemDialCmd:           ATX3DP%s
I know that ATX3 is for disabling the tone detection
did you checkk manual dialing using minicom or similar? does it work?
edit /etc/wcdial.conf to add a phone-number and try dialing
or "phone = 555 0815"  not sure, haven't used it for a while
add a line "Dial Command = ATDP" to /etc/wvdial.conf
basically you have to setup your serial-port and speed/handshake (likely 8n1). then type "atz<enter>" "atdp<your isps number>enter>"
oooh its so long ago... ctrl-a-h   for help?
ctrl-a x  to quit (ctrl-a  generally starts commands)
its just a test if pulsedialing works. it wont affect other apps
i thought all modems can use pulse-dialing, but are you sure yours can too?
